@randir12 The readme file says

"If you get an error saying "Error defining external function"
please install one of the files in the "folder redist".

Use the x64 version if you're on a 64-bit system.
Otherwise use the x86 version."

Hey there! 

I'm Jonatan Soderstrom, me and my friend Dennis Wedin made this game. We're working on an update that hopefully will take care of any/all bugs, and we'll try to do some extra polish in the next few days. Would be great if you could update the torrent when the patch is out! It'd be great if people get to play it without any bugs popping up.

Hope everyone will enjoy the game!

For the "Error defining an external function." problem, try restarting your system and play again, it can pop up when your computer has been running for a while. We'll try to figure out if there's more to it than that.

I just wanted to comment that I think it's great that cactus69 has been commenting here. Games 'will' be pirated, that's just how things work for now. If a downloader has a really negative experience with a title, they will NOT buy it for sure, and they will likely tell their friends about it. If they have a good experience, they 'may' buy it, and will likely tell their friends how cool the game is. That's my opinion on it. I think cactus69 commenting here will only help. I know I bought FO3 after downloading it. I had so many issues with Metro 2033, I deleted it and told my friends not to waste their time/money on it. Anyway, thanks cactus69 for having an open mind!

If you get error on startup failed to load game data do this.
Click on the start icon, type in services.msc ,run it and find the printer spooler process and disable it.

Okay, for anyone having problems with any levels, I'll teach you how to edit these files.
 Warning: Back up your save.dat file FIRST.
First head to this file directory: C:Users[YOUR NAME HEREAppDataLocalVirtualStoreProgram Files (x86)Hotline Miami 
You should see a file under the name saves.dat there. Edit this file using word pad or any other this similar to that. This is where it gets a bit tricky. 
1 represents something that is unlocked. (such as a level or a mask) 0 represents something that hasn't been unlocked yet, so it is locked.
Line 1: Refers to what masks are unlocked. Order is the same as the masks appear in the selection screen.

Line 2: Refers to levels unlocked. Order is the same as normal level progession.

Line 3: Refers to weapons unlocked. Order is the same as they are unlocked normally.

Line 4: Refers to puzzle letters found. Order is unknown.

Line 5: Refers to overall score obtained. i.e. Every time you finish a level, that levels score is added to this regardless if you have done the level before.

Line 6-25: Refers to the highest rating obtained on all the levels on a scale of 0-15. Line 6 refers to the prologue, line 7 refers to chapter 1 etc etc.
Line 26-45: Refers to the highest score obtained on a level. Line 26 refers to the prologue, line 27 refers to chapter 1 etc etc.

Line 46: Indicates whether the player has solved the puzzle or not. This can be set to solved even if the player does not have all the letter pieces. 
Doing this will make your game unlock these and allow you to progress thru further!
